title: Shrimp in Chipotle  Sauce (Camarones Enchipolados)
ingredients: 3 pounds large shrimp, clean and deveined
instructions: If you’ve made the “enchipolado” sauce ahead remove it from the refrigerator and allow it to come to room temperature.  Have it ready, and at hand, when you start cooking.
If the shrimp are not already deveined, devein them, keeping their tails, and clean them under cold running water.  Set them aside until needed.

Set a large skillet over medium heat, add the oil and when it’s hot lightly brown the onions.  Add the shrimp and sauté just until they turn pink – not a moment longer.  Quickly add the “enchipolado” sauce and stir the mixture for a final 30 seconds – again no longer.
Remarks:  In  this dish is served with a green salad, steamed rice, and tortillas to scoop up the sauce.
Source:  A Cook’s Tour of Mexico by Nancy Zaslavsky, published by St. Martin’s Press, New York, New York, © 1995 by Nancy Zaslavsky.
